title: Pokémon Sword and Shield got a 24-hour livestream to give fans a preview
text:
New York (CNN Business) The Pokémon Company just gave fans 24 hours to get familiar with two new upcoming games by tuning into a livestream that ended at 9 a.m. ET on Saturday.

On average, about 25,000 people were watching the stream at any given time throughout the day. It was produced to promote the new "Pokémon Sword" and "Shield" games arriving on Nintendo Switch on November 15. Viewers were able to watch new characters appear in a mysterious, fictional forest.On average, about 25,000 people were watching the stream at any given time throughout the day. It was produced to promote the new "Pokémon Sword" and "Shield" games arriving on Nintendo Switch on November 15.

Nintendo NTDOF is hoping that by adding new games to existing franchises it can keep breathing life into its Switch gaming consoles.

Towards the end of the livestream, amidst the peaceful sounds of chimes, two new Pokémon galloped into view. They're so far unnamed but they resemble an existing Pokémon, Ponyta, albeit more colorful.

Lengthy livestreams have become an increasingly popular way to promote new products, especially in the entertainment and gaming industries. Fans seem willing to sit through videos that span many hours, often multitasking during the streams to help the time pass.
